metadata.title: CVE-2020-7238 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: Netty 4.1.43.Final allows HTTP Request Smuggling because it mishandles Transfer-Encoding whitespace (such as a [space]Transfer-Encoding:chunked line) and a later Content-Length header. This issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2019-16869. It was discovered that Netty has HTTP request smuggling vulnerability. A remote attacker could use it to extract sensitive information.

criterions.comment: netty package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.1.45-1').
